ch.uzh.agglorecommender.clusterer.treesearch

Class ClusterSet<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.uzh.agglorecommender.clusterer.treesearch.ClusterSet<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of objects to cluster
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IClusterSet<E>, java.io.Serializable

    public class ClusterSet<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, IClusterSet<E>
    Stores the objects to cluster. With getCombinationsList() a set of all possible combinations (merges) up to the specified MAX_SUBSET_SIZE can be retrieved.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        Determines if a de-serialized file is compatible with this class.

        Maintainers must change this value if and only if the new version of this class is not compatible with old versions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_SUBSET_SIZE

        private final int MAX_SUBSET_SIZE
        All generated subsets have size <= MAX_SUBSET_SIZE. This limit reduces the number of generated sets from 
         C(set_size, 2) +  C(set_size, 3) + ... + C(set_size,set_size)

        to 
         C(set_size, 2) +  C(set_size, 3) + ... + C(set_size, MAX_SUBSET_SIZE)

        with n = set_size, m = length_of_sublist, and 
                          n!
  C(n,m) = ----------------
              m! (n - m)!

        Which is the binomial coefficient for nonnegative n and m: the number of ways of picking unordered outcomes from possibilities, also known as a combination or combinatorial number.
        (Calculating the complete power set would result in generating 2^n subsets.)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • openNodes

        private IndexAwareSet<E> openNodes
        Stores the instances to cluster.

      • combinationIndices

        private java.util.Set<scala.collection.immutable.List<java.lang.Short>> combinationIndices
        A list of all currently valid comparisons indices. Used to generate a the set of valid node comparisons.

      • combinationsMap

        private com.google.common.collect.HashMultimap<java.lang.Short,scala.collection.immutable.List<java.lang.Short>> combinationsMap
        Maps to each currently valid comparison index all possible comparisons (multimap). Used for keeping the combinationIndices set in sync with the cluster set.

      • cachedNodeLists

        private java.util.Map<scala.collection.immutable.List<java.lang.Short>,java.util.List<E>> cachedNodeLists

    • Method Detail

      • calcNumberOfInitialCombinations

        private int calcNumberOfInitialCombinations()
        Calculate the total number of possible node combinations. Depends on the defined MAX_SUBSET_SIZE
        Returns:
        number of possible combinations

      • initializeCombinationsMap

        private void initializeCombinationsMap()
        Adds a mapping of each index to all the combinations that involves this index.

      • initializeCombinationIndices

        private void initializeCombinationIndices(int initialNumberOfCombinations)
        Calculates all possible combinations,limited to subset size <= MAX_SUBSET_SIZE, of the indices of the openNodes set (IndexAwareSet). The resulting index lists are stored in combinationIndices.

      • initializeDualCombinationIndices

        private void initializeDualCombinationIndices(int initialNumberOfCombinations)

      • newScalaList

        @SafeVarargs
private static <T> scala.collection.immutable.List<T> newScalaList(T... ts)

      • newScalaList

      • updateCombinationIndices

        private void updateCombinationIndices(short newIndex)
        Is called upon addition of a node to the openSet and updates combinationsMap and combinationIndices with the new combination indices lists (limited to sublist length <= MAX_SUBSET_SIZE).
